author: keccack256
content: <@520564582196969472> playing around with your supply api a bit, any insight into the discrepancy of yours vs Etherscan’s?

author: keccack256
content: I tried digging through the code to see if there was something maybe uncle related or an over count of genesis distribution but nada. Currently almost 1m ETH ahead of Etherscan, and theirs is “supposed” to be latest block as well I believe

author: mandrigin
content:
<@276099850918166529> etherscan shows issuance and not supply. Basically what I show is the sum of the amounts of all accounts out there. What they show is a bit more complicated: the sum of actual issued Ethereum via genesis and then all rewards combined. These are not the same things and I don’t know why they call it “supply” because it is not.
I didn’t have time to implement issuance calculation myself...

author: mandrigin
content: Also they don’t show for which block they calculate which is super annoying and makes it essentially useless.

author: mandrigin
content:
You can see the explanation of difference between issuance and supply here: https://github.com/lastmjs/eth-total-supply

But also I’m not sure that Etherecan shows even the right issuance, I remember testing that locally and wasn’t able to get the number that they have any way I counted.
